extendedIngredients.name: beets
extendedIngredients.original: 4 medium beets (about 1 pound), preferably a mixture of red and yellow

title: Roasted Beet Crostini with Zucchini Flowers
summary: The recipe Roasted Beet Crostini with Zucchini Flowers is ready in around 45 minutes and is definitely an amazing vegan option for lovers of Mediterranean food. One portion of this dish contains approximately 3g of protein, 7g of fat, and a total of 120 calories. For 87 cents per serving, this recipe covers 9% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 8. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. It works well as a very reasonably priced hor d'oeuvre. Head to the store and pick up olive oil, beets, salt and pepper, and a few other things to make it today. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 59%. This score is pretty good. Similar recipes are Roasted Beet Crostini, Festive Roasted Beet Crostini, and Roasted Beet and Goat Cheese Crostini.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 450. Loosely wrap the beets in foil and roast for about 1 hour, or until tender. Let cool slightly, then peel the beets and cut them into 1/2 -inch dice. Combine the beets with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil, the vinegar, rosemary, crushed red pepper and a generous pinch each of salt and black pepper.                                               Heat a grill pan. Lightly brush the bread on both sides with the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil and grill until crisp and golden. Fold the zucchini flowers into the beet mixture, divide evenly among the grilled bread slices and serve.

steps.step: Loosely wrap the beets in foil and roast for about 1 hour, or until tender.
Let cool slightly, then peel the beets and cut them into 1/2 -inch dice.
Combine the beets with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil, the vinegar, rosemary, crushed red pepper and a generous pinch each of salt and black pepper.

Heat a grill pan. Lightly brush the bread on both sides with the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil and grill until crisp and golden. Fold the zucchini flowers into the beet mixture, divide evenly among the grilled bread slices and serve.
